cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles east of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest along the Florida coast, expected to turn north Wednesday evening, then accelerate north-northeast paralleling the coasts of Georgia and the Carolinas before passing offshore of the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Near or along the South Carolina/North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from the NC/VA border to Chincoteague VA and Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Sebastian Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL and from north of Savannah River to Surf City NC; Storm Surge Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Surf City NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeastern U.S. coast from Florida to North Carolina, then offshore of the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Friday into early Saturday as the storm passes well offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; surge threat confined south of Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible (1–3 inches), but widespread heavy rainfall (>4 inches) not expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf, dangerous rip currents, and minor coastal inundation possible along Delaware beaches
